title: Bill Clinton’s Impeachment Didn’t Hurt the Stock Market. Donald Trump’s Probably Won’t Either.
text:
It’s official: Speaker of the House Nancy Pelosi announced that the House of Representatives will open a formal impeachment inquiry into President Donald Trump. Being market reporters, we’ll leave the punditry to Fox News, CNN, and the rest. What we care about is the impact on the stock market, and from what little information we have to go by, impeachment doesn’t seem to be high on the list of concerns.

We don’t have a lot of examples to go by. Andrew Johnson was impeached—but not convicted—in 1868, and while I’m sure there...
description: President Trump’s impeachment proceedings will get all the attention, but the economy matters more for the stock market, if history is a guide.
